<td height="23" bgcolor="#FFFFFF" class="menunormalcell"><a href="sustainability_resources.htm" title="Environmental Policy Statement"> >> Sustainability Resources
<td width="62%" align="center" valign="top"> <table width="98%" height="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" summary="layout table">

Leeds Trinity, like all organisations, should behave responsibily in the way that it impacts on the environment. It aims to do this by putting in place a range of measures that form part of its environmental management system and more generally by conducting its business in a sustainable manner.

In order to provide the framework for its activities the institution has developed an Environmental Policy, outlined below, and has made sustainability a whole-College matter through the operations of its Environmental Forum.
You may be interested in what we have said about our activities in our submission for a Green Gown Award.

Trinity & All Saints is committed to sustainable development and will contribute positively to the environment.  We will develop in a way that meets the needs of the present without diminishing the opportunities of those in the future.  This ethical and practical commitment is at the heart of the College’s mission and values.

We will seek to continuously improve through a programme of activities that will promote sustainable development and minimise the harmful effects of our operations.  We will work with the others to progress environmental initiatives and share best practice.
In particular we will develop an environmental management system that will:
• Make environmental best practice part of our culture;
• Reuse and recycle equipment and materials and dispose of materials in an environmentally sensitive manner;
• Promote and manage efficiency in our current operations and in capital projects;
• Enable students to acquire skills, values and knowledge around sustainable development;
• Set objectives and targets and enable us to measure our performance.
The framework for delivering the environmental management system will involve all parts of the College.

An Environmental Forum will be established.  It will be representative of the College’s diversity and include staff with responsibility for teaching and research, estate management, finance, purchasing, cleaning, security, distribution, transport, waste management and health and safety. The Forum will produce an annual report for consideration by College management, Academic Board and the Board of Governors.  It was also agree and oversee the delivery of an annual action plan
There will be particular strands of activity that will report into the Forum, including:
Each department will have an Environmental Champion who will provide advice and support for locally based initiatives.
All Saints, Brownberrie Lane, Horsforth, Leeds, LS18 5HD
